trans-unit.source: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.
trans-unit.target: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.

trans-unit.source: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
trans-unit.target: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

trans-unit.source: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."
trans-unit.target: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."

trans-unit.source: {2}{U}: Copy target instant spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy. {2}{R}: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.

trans-unit.source: "Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"\n—Trivaz, Izzet mage
trans-unit.target: "Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"\n—Trivaz, Izzet mage

trans-unit.target: Flying Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

trans-unit.source: "The blazekite is a simple concept, really—just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."\n—Juzba, Izzet tinker

trans-unit.target: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

trans-unit.source: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.
trans-unit.target: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.

trans-unit.source: Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it. {UR}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn. trans-unit.target: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

trans-unit.source: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

trans-unit.target: When Izzet Chronarch enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

trans-unit.source: He ensures not only whether but also when and where the lightning strikes twice.
trans-unit.target: He ensures not only whether but also when and where the lightning strikes twice.

trans-unit.target: Flying Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

trans-unit.source: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
trans-unit.target: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

DDJ·72 | Feast or Famine | Card Text
trans-unit.source: Choose one — Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield; or destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature and it can't be regenerated.
trans-unit.target: Choose one — Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield; or destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature and it can't be regenerated.

trans-unit.resname: DDJ·72 | Feast or Famine | Flavor Text
trans-unit.source: "The living cannot understand the benefits of death."\n—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
trans-unit.target: "The living cannot understand the benefits of death."\n—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn

trans-unit.source: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)
trans-unit.target: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Otherwise, draw a card.)

trans-unit.source: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
trans-unit.target: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

trans-unit.source: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.
trans-unit.target: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

trans-unit.source: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.
trans-unit.target: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

trans-unit.source: "Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."\n—Halana of Ulvenwald
trans-unit.target: "Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."\n—Halana of Ulvenwald

trans-unit.source: You may cast Twilight's Call any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it. Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
trans-unit.target: You may cast Twilight's Call any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it. Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

trans-unit.source: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
trans-unit.target: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

trans-unit.source: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost. Ryan Barger
